content.description: Climb the right arete all the way up. The crux is the final move over the round bulgy exit then step left to the anchor.
content.protection: Top Rope Only. Walk up the gully on the right. Two bolt anchor. Bring long runners and a utility cord.
content.location: The far right side of Beethoven's wall. Climb to the right of the large waco near the top.

content.description: Start around the corner to the left - up onto a ledge then using a hold on the arete step around somewhat gingerly onto the sloping footholds, to be presented with the crux. A technical and balancy sequence leads to better holds. Now follow the arete as closely as possible to the tricky finish over the final obstacle. Classic and airy.
content.protection: Toprope - blocks on the top are more than adequate to set up an anchor.
content.location: The left edge of the wall.

content.description: Start just to the right of the crack straight up to a mantle move. Straight up from here. The crux is about 25 feet up left of the huge hueco.
content.protection: Strictly top rope by hiking up the 3rd class gully on the right. Two new bolts on top for an anchor. Bring long runners and a utility cord.
content.location: Just to the right of the center crack.

content.description: Just left of The Crack, a stiff move is shared with Center Route, then straight up past the ledge to a very thin and smeary finish.

Good - with a way fun finish.

Start just left of center and gain a foothold on the only big jug at the start. The crux leads through the next section and now uses holds on the right also (as part of the Direct Route). Trend leftwards as soon as possible then up to the undercling and ledge. Finish up the lovely wall above using pockets and flat holds, a final stem leads to the finish.

A fun little route, the crux is near the middle. A good warm up though before starting on the 5.10's to the left. This route is the only crack on the wall, it's a few feet left of the tree that grows to the right of the wall.
content.protection: If memory serves me correctly this is a top rope only wall. There are a series of anchors dotting the top of the rock. A good place to take beginners.
content.location: This area can be a little confusing for the first time, so bring a guide book there are a lot of boulders, brush, & slot canyons. But park on the road near the north end of the formation and follow the obvious climbers/partiers trail, it will fork stay to your right and head towards the rocks. Beethoven's wall is the last main area before turning the corner south. Once at the base there is quite a bit of room for belaying which is good because this is a popular area and can get a bit crowded, especially on weekends.
